text:
• The portrayal to Adrian that I "won't reply" about visits misrepresents my efforts and damages my relationship with him.
• Emergency communication protocols are a standard safety consideration, and you allow for no way to accommodate them.
• The concerning shift in Adrian's view of MIT from pride to mockery between visits suggests harmful negative influences on him.
Please maintain our message thread rather than forking and creating new ones. Forking threads can misrepresent the context and chronology of
our communication, which has happened a lot since this began. I don't think that is helpful to either of us when seeking helpful advice.
Looking forward to understanding a healthier way to address the points above, as they were not addressed in a constructive way.
robert
On 12/28/2024 at 09:45 AM, Christine Moyer wrote:
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/28/2024 at 09:49 AM)
Subject:Re: AD is asleep
I’ll  send this to Cimberleigh. She asked I share these types of comms.
On 12/28/2024 at 09:39 AM, Robert Moyer wrote:
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/28/2024 at 09:41 AM)
Subject:Re: AD is asleep
Is he still coming over today?
For that matter, if they are in a car wreck getting here, what is your and Natalie’s plan for us to communicate and figure that out? Is it just wait
till we both know they are missing AND you check OFW? Curious.
On 12/28/2024 at 09:01 AM, Robert Moyer wrote:
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: Never)
Subject:AD is asleep
Does he know he’s coming over?
Last Thursday he said he was not sure to me and Alan. I said it was “a regular day so count on it”. To which he replied “I know but Mom said
you won’t reply so we don’t know “  Let’s work on that. It’s not really fair to couch me that way.
Also not sure where he got the idea that MIT was like Phoenix university but that happened between his visits. He started proud and then was
kinda teasing me next time. Admission was super tough and the classes are really hard.
Maybe these things are beyond your control but bringing it up so you know I don’t think it’s good for him to look at me like some kind of
clown. I know you replaced me on July 4th, but he can’t so let’s make the best of it for him.
Message 275 of 287
These comms are not to air grievances.
Yes if you can reimburse the costs from July for kids medical insurance.and other costs that would be great too.
Sent:12/28/2024 at 03:50 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/28/2024 at 03:50 PM)
Subject:Re: Seahawks ticket sale
